P.title: Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extra terrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

Q.title: Will we find life on Mars by 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions.
If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as No

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Europa will be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045, and (b) we will find life on Mars by 2050?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.

P.title: Will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question

GENREAL: Output your general reasoning and thought process.  Here you can be as detailed as you want mentioning the reasoning of your predictions as well as how / why each prediction obeys the given consistency rules.  For each prediction you are welcome to be as verbose as you want. If there are multiple questions P, Q, you can also make comments on their independence or relationship with each other.

PROB: Output your probability estimates of each of the variables (P, Q, not_P etc).  Here, ONLY output the labels and its associated predictions and NOTHING ELSE. Your output MUST look like and be formatted like the following.
    P: 0.xx
    not_P: 0.xx
    P_or_Q: 0.xx
    ...

CHECK: Go through each rule in CONSISTENCY RULES and check whether each rule is obeyed with your given predictions.  For each rule, first print out the mathematical rule and the associated numbers associated with it.  Then think VERY carefully about whether the outputs obey the mathematical rule. Then output whether it obeys the rule. Your output MUST look like and be formatted like the following.
    neg: P = 1- not_P, EQUATION is EVALUATION
    andor: P = P_or_Q + P_and_Q - Q, EQUATION is EVALUATION
    and:  max(P + Q - 1, 0) <= P_and_Q <= min(P, Q), EQUATION is EVALUATION
    ...
    {ALL consistency checks passed!} OR {failed_check_1, failed_check_2 ... consistency checks failed!}

PROB: Now again output your probability estimates of each variable in a dict like format like before, but taking account and correcting any consistency violations that occured before.
        Note that changing the probability of one given variable for one consistency check will also affect consistency rules for others.  It is IMPERATIVE that all changes  
        your correction needs to ENSURE that it still passes other consistency checks too.
        If there were no violations found then simply output the same dict again.  Your output MUST look like and be formatted like the following.
        P: 0.xx
        not_P: 0.xx
        P_or_Q: 0.xx
        ...
FLOAT: Now just output your probability estimate of P and nothing else as a decimal!

In this set of questions, we are assessing the probabilities related to the potential candidacy of members of the Trump family for the Republican nomination in 2024, as well as the likelihood of armed conflicts between the United States and China resulting in at least 100 deaths before 2050. 

1. **P (Trump Family Nominee)**: I predict a moderate probability of 0.65 for a member of the Trump family being the Republican nominee for the presidency in 2024. This takes into account Donald Trump's significant influence and popularity within the Republican party, as well as the potential candidacy of other family members.

2. **not_P (No Trump Family Nominee)**: The probability for no member of the Trump family being the nominee is therefore 0.35, as it is simply the complement of P.

3. **para_P (Possibility of Trump Family Nominee)**: This is expected to be close to P, so I estimate it at 0.65 as well, reflecting the possibility that a Trump family member could still secure the nomination.

4. **Q (Armed Conflicts with China)**: I estimate a lower probability of 0.30 for armed conflicts leading to at least 100 deaths before 2050. This reflects the ongoing tensions but also the hope that diplomatic measures will prevent such escalations.

5. **P_and_Q (Both Events Occurring)**: For both a Trump family member being the nominee and armed conflicts resulting in deaths, I estimate a probability of 0.20. This reflects the lower likelihood of both events happening simultaneously.

6. **P_or_Q (Either Event Occurring)**: The probability for either event occurring is higher, so I estimate it at 0.75, considering the higher likelihood of at least one of these scenarios happening.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Conflicts Occurring with No Trump Nominee)**: I estimate a probability of 0.15 for the scenario where conflicts occur but no Trump family member is the nominee, reflecting the independence of these two events.

8. **Q_given_P (Conflicts Given Trump Nominee)**: Given that a Trump family member is the nominee, I estimate the probability of conflicts leading to deaths at 0.35, reflecting a potential increase in tensions due to political dynamics.

Overall, the independence of the events is somewhat maintained, particularly between the political scenario and international conflicts, although there may be some correlation due to the political climate.

Q.title: Will there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if there is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory
Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040 and (b) there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) At any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway.

P.title: Will there be a "World War Three" before 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true:
There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing.
At least 10 million people (civillians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
[see edit history in the fine print]
Fine Print
PPP will may be determined from the following sources, in order of precedence:
IMF
World Bank
United Nations
CIA
[2022-03-24]: Edited to clarify that "world GDP" will be determined in PPP for condition 1 .
[2021-11-24]: Edited to clarify the time constraints.
(Edit 1/16/19 to remove third "described as WWIII" criterion.)

### Predictions:
1. **P (Trump family nominee)**: Given Donald Trump's prominence in the Republican Party and the potential for family members to seek political office, I estimate a moderately high probability that a member of the Trump family will be the nominee. This is influenced by Trump's continued popularity among a significant segment of the Republican base.

2. **not_P (No Trump family nominee)**: This is simply the complement of P. If I estimate P at a certain probability, not_P will naturally follow as 1 - P. The lower the probability of P, the higher the probability of not_P.

3. **para_P (Possibility of Trump nominee)**: This should closely align with P, as both reflect the same underlying question but are framed differently. Thus, I expect this to have a similar probability.

4. **Q (China conflict deaths)**: The geopolitical tensions between the US and China are significant, and while armed conflict is a serious concern, the actual occurrence of events leading to 100 deaths is uncertain. I will estimate this probability based on historical data of conflicts and current military posturing.

5. **P_and_Q (Both events occur)**: This probability will depend on the interaction between P and Q. If both events are somewhat independent, I will calculate it based on the probabilities of P and Q.

6. **P_or_Q (Either event occurs)**: This probability will be influenced by the individual probabilities of P and Q. If they are independent, I will use the formula for the union of two events.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Q occurs while not P)**: This is a conditional probability that will require careful consideration of the independence of the two events. I will assess how likely it is for the conflict to occur without a Trump family member as the nominee.

8. **Q_given_P (Q occurs given P)**: This is a conditional probability that will be influenced by whether a Trump family member is the nominee. I will consider how the political dynamics may affect the likelihood of conflict.

### Independence Considerations:
- P and Q may not be entirely independent; the political climate can influence international relations. However, I will consider them as largely independent for the purpose of this estimation unless evidence suggests otherwise.

I will ensure that all the probability estimates adhere to the consistency rules provided, especially regarding negation, conjunction, and disjunction. I will double-check calculations to ensure that they do not violate any mathematical relationships among the variables.

Q.title: Will the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if the price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050

In this evaluation, we are considering the probabilities of various events related to the Republican nomination for the US Presidency in 2024 involving members of the Trump family and the potential for armed conflicts between the United States and China leading to significant casualties. 

**P (Trump Family Nominee)**: I estimate a moderate probability that a member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, given the current political landscape and the prominence of Donald Trump. This probability reflects factors such as Trump's previous presidency and ongoing influence within the Republican Party.

**not_P (No Trump Family Nominee)**: This is simply the complement of P, representing the probability that no member of the Trump family will be the nominee. Given the moderate probability assigned to P, not_P is estimated as the remaining probability.

**para_P (Possibility of Trump Family Nominee)**: This probability is expected to align closely with P, as it essentially asks if it is possible for a Trump family member to secure the nomination. Given the context, this should be similar to P's estimate.

**Q (China-US Conflict Casualties)**: The probability that armed conflicts between the US and China will lead to at least 100 deaths by 2050 is influenced by ongoing geopolitical tensions and historical conflicts. I estimate this probability to be moderate, considering the potential for escalation in military confrontations.

**P_and_Q (Both Events Occur)**: This probability is the joint probability that both a Trump family member will be the nominee and that the conflict will lead to casualties. Since both events are somewhat independent, I estimate this probability by considering the individual probabilities of P and Q.

**P_or_Q (Either Event Occurs)**: This probability reflects the likelihood that at least one of the two events occurs. Given the independent nature of P and Q, I will calculate this using the formula for the union of two independent events.

**Q_and_not_P (China Conflict and No Trump Nominee)**: This probability considers the scenario where a conflict occurs, but no Trump family member is the nominee. This requires a careful balance of the probabilities of Q and not_P.

**Q_given_P (China Conflict Given Trump Nominee)**: This conditional probability examines the likelihood of conflict casualties given that a Trump family member is the nominee. The reasoning behind this estimate focuses on the potential political ramifications and military decisions influenced by the nomination.

In summary, the relationships between these probabilities will be guided by the consistency rules provided, ensuring that calculations adhere to logical constraints such as complements, independence, and conditional probabilities.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) a "World War Three" before 2050 and (b) the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true:
(a) There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing, and at least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
(b) The price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050.

Fine Print
PPP will may be determined from the following sources, in order of precedence:
IMF
World Bank
United Nations
CIA
[2022-03-24]: Edited to clarify that "world GDP" will be determined in PPP for condition 1.
[2021-11-24]: Edited to clarify the time constraints.
(Edit 1/16/19 to remove third "described as WWIII" criterion.)
